revised_title: Development of Behavioral Autonomy in Animal Intelligence
tldr: The study investigates the development of behavioral autonomy in animal intelligence, focusing on the distinction between the teleological model and the stimulus-response model. The research finds that a simple food-rewarded activity is sensitive to reward devaluation in rats following limited training, suggesting that the same activity can be either an action or a habit depending on the type of training it receives.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
